results.title: Getting the message
results.brief_description: The mass media are being studied by scholars today more closely than ever before. Media study has been lagging behind but it is suggested that teaching at school level may help. This film shows what is being done in Tasmanian schools today with the critical study of news media and the study of film and television as an art form. It is one of the few states in Australia with a compulsory course in mass media as an examination subject in all secondary schools. The aim - to make students grow into discriminating adults.

results.title: Getting the job: personal experiences with selection panels
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education. Film, Television and Audio Unit and Lily Steiner
results.brief_description: Focuses on the strategies women employ in order to maximise their chances in job applications. 1. Getting the job. Details the strategies that can be used in job applications as well as techniques to help ensure a successful interview. Women who have been successful in obtaining positions talk about their experiences in applying for jobs. 2 Personal Experiences with Selection Panels. Several women who have been successful in obtaining positions within the Ministry of Education give advice on their experiences in applying for jobs.

results.title: Getting the best out of hardware
results.brief_description: Summary: a great deal of expensive computer time can be wasted in running programs. shows where this time is wasted and how it can be saved by The Use of Operating Systems. The film includes demonstrations of the operator action required to set up and run three jobs with and without a simple batch operation system. slow motion film of card reader and line printer mechanisms reveal that a major source of time wasting is in input/ output operations. the film ends using a special model to show the principle behind a multiprogramming operating system

results.title: Getting straight
results.brief_description: A cinema verite style documentary that follows three people going through their last days in detoxification clinics prior to re-entry into the community. This program gives a clear insight into the treatment and philosophies of Alcoholics Anonymous in their dealings with alcoholics and drug dependent persons.

results.title: Getting started
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Jerry Krepakevich, Michael Scott and Richard Condie
results.brief_description: In this animated film the hero attempts to practise a piece of music on the piano. A series of distractions delays him and, when he finally sits down to play, pandemonium breaks loose. A short film that will appeal to those of us who tend to procrastinate. (Awards include: Toronto, Zagreb)

results.title: Getting ready to read (TEFC)
results.brief_description: This film examines the role that parents can play in helping their children to read. Reading is just one part of literacy so this role begins in the earliest months of a baby’s life. Methods of reading in schools are also examined.

results.title: Getting on the bandwagon
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Nicholas Balla and Gudrun Parker
results.brief_description: To stimulate discussion, questions the basis on which people form their tastes, illustrating the fairly common tendency to go along with the crowd and to stay on the safe side of a difference of opinion. When the parents of her close friend first see the painting of a new artist they consider them odd and unconventional, but after her work is discovered by a socially prominent family they join the chorus of approval. Invites the audiences to comment on the prevalence pf independence or conformity of thought.

results.title: Getting married
results.brief_description: Explores the whole problem of marrying young. Linda and Rodger aged 16 and 20 respectively, discuss their marriage plans with the vicar and their parents. Other couples who have married in their teens, talk about their attitude to sex before marriage and to contraception.
